title: Poems and Fragments
description: Thomas Beddoes was a poet and playwright of the 19th century who is most famous for his play "Death's Jestbook." His poetry is vivid, highly imaginative, well-wrought, and generally of a sensitive, delicate, and often morbid turn of mind. He has had a great influence on many writers more famous than he.
author: Thomas Lovell Beddoes
